meanings.definition: The quality or state of being fragmented.
meanings.sent1: The fragmentarinesses of the puzzle made it challenging to complete.
meanings.sent2: The artist's painting captured the fragmentarinesses of the broken mirror.
meanings.sent3: The fragmentarinesses of the jigsaw puzzle caused a lot of confusion.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were a jumble of fragmentarinesses, like scattered puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent5: The fragmentarinesses of the shattered glass reflected the chaos of the situation.

meanings.definition: The condition of being incomplete or disjointed.
meanings.sent1: The fragmentarinesses of the story left the readers wanting more.
meanings.sent2: The old map showed the fragmentarinesses of the ancient city's layout.
meanings.sent3: The fragmentarinesses of the plan made it difficult to follow.
meanings.sent4: His memories were like pieces of fragmentarinesses, scattered and disconnected.
meanings.sent5: The fragmentarinesses of the broken bridge symbolized the obstacles ahead.
